animals.name: Aardvark
animals.habitat: Found in savannas and grasslands
animals.data: Weighs between 110 and 180 pounds
animals.info: Nocturnal insectivore
animals.fact: Have a keen sense of smell
animals.description: Known for their long snouts and powerful digging abilities.

animals.name: Aardwolf
animals.habitat: Found on open grasslands
animals.data: Mainly insectivorous
animals.info: Solitary and nocturnal animals
animals.fact: Hyena-like but feed on termites
animals.description: Small, insect-eating hyenas known for their termite-rich diet.

animals.name: Albatross
animals.habitat: Found on the open ocean and coastlines
animals.data: Wingspan can reach up to 12 feet
animals.info: Excellent long-distance fliers
animals.fact: Can sleep while flying
animals.description: Large seabirds renowned for their impressive wingspan and long-distance flights.

animals.name: Alligator
animals.habitat: Found in freshwater environments like swamps and rivers
animals.data: Can grow up to 13 feet in length
animals.info: Cold-blooded reptiles with powerful jaws
animals.fact: Have a lifespan of up to 35-50 years
animals.description: Large reptiles known for their formidable jaws and semi-aquatic lifestyles.

animals.name: Alpaca
animals.habitat: Found in the Andes Mountains of South America
animals.data: Cousin of the llama
animals.info: Raised for their soft and luxurious fleece
animals.fact: Gentle and social animals
animals.description: Domesticated camelids known for their fine fleece and friendly nature.

animals.name: Amphibian
animals.habitat: Found in various aquatic and terrestrial environments
animals.data: Can breathe through their skin
animals.info: Undergo metamorphosis during their life cycle
animals.fact: Bioindicators of environmental health
animals.description: Amphibians are a diverse group of animals that live both in water and on land during their life cycle.

animals.name: Anaconda
animals.habitat: Found in the Amazon rainforest and other tropical regions
animals.data: One of the largest snake species in the world
animals.info: Constrictor that preys on large mammals and birds
animals.fact: Give birth to live young
animals.description: Giant constrictor snakes known for their immense size and ambush hunting.

animals.name: Angelfish
animals.habitat: Found in coral reefs of the tropical oceans
animals.data: Come in various colorful species
animals.info: Popular in the aquarium trade
animals.fact: Known for their striking patterns
animals.description: Brightly colored, tropical fish admired for their vibrant appearance.

animals.name: Anglerfish
animals.habitat: Found in the deep sea
animals.data: Females are much larger than males
animals.info: Use a bioluminescent lure to attract prey
animals.fact: Have a unique reproductive strategy
animals.description: Mysterious deep-sea fish known for their bioluminescent lure and bizarre mating habits.

animals.name: Ant
animals.habitat: Found in colonies underground and on the surface
animals.data: Strong and highly organized social insects
animals.info: Communicate using pheromones
animals.fact: Can carry objects many times their own body weight
animals.description: Highly organized social insects that live in colonies and work together to accomplish tasks.

animals.name: Anteater
animals.habitat: Found in forests and grasslands of Central and South America
animals.data: Specialized tongue for eating ants and termites
animals.info: Solitary and primarily nocturnal
animals.fact: Can consume thousands of insects in a day
animals.description: Unique mammals with long snouts and tongues adapted for eating ants and termites.

animals.name: Antelope
animals.habitat: Found in a variety of grassland and woodland habitats
animals.data: Fast runners and agile jumpers
animals.info: Many species exhibit sexual dimorphism
animals.fact: Herbivorous and have a keen sense of hearing
animals.description: Graceful herbivores known for their speed and agility in grassland ecosystems.

animals.name: Antlion
animals.habitat: Found in sandy environments
animals.data: Larvae create pitfall traps for prey
animals.info: Adult resemble dragonflies
animals.fact: Skilled ambush predators
animals.description: Insect species known for their unique predatory behavior and larval pitfall traps.

animals.name: Ape
animals.habitat: Found in tropical rainforests and a few other environments
animals.data: Closest relatives to humans
animals.info: Species include gorillas, chimpanzees, bonobos, and orangutans
animals.fact: Have complex social structures
animals.description: Highly intelligent primates known for their close genetic relation to humans.

animals.name: Aphid
animals.habitat: Found on plants and trees
animals.data: Small, soft-bodied insects
animals.info: Reproduce rapidly through a process called parthenogenesis
animals.fact: Pests to many crops and garden plants
animals.description: Tiny insects known for their rapid reproduction and ability to damage plants.

animals.name: Armadillo
animals.habitat: Found in a range of environments, from forests to grasslands
animals.data: Protected by a bony armor-like shell
animals.info: Good swimmers and diggers
animals.fact: Primarily insectivorous
animals.description: Small mammals known for their unique armored shells and adaptable habitats.

animals.name: Asp
animals.habitat: Found in dry and rocky areas of Africa and the Middle East
animals.data: Venomous snake species
animals.info: Associated with ancient Egyptian mythology
animals.fact: Venom contains potent neurotoxins
animals.description: Venomous snakes known for their historical significance in ancient Egyptian culture.

animals.name: Baboon
animals.habitat: Found in savannas and open woodlands
animals.data: Omnivorous and highly social primates
animals.info: Distinctive dog-like snouts and colorful bottoms
animals.fact: Known for their complex social hierarchies
animals.description: Old World monkeys known for their distinctive appearance and social behaviors.

animals.name: Badger
animals.habitat: Found in a variety of habitats, including forests and grasslands
animals.data: Burrowing mammals with powerful claws
animals.info: Solitary and primarily nocturnal hunters
animals.fact: Known for their digging prowess
animals.description: Stout-bodied mammals recognized for their burrowing and hunting skills.

animals.name: Bandicoot
animals.habitat: Found in forests, grasslands, and coastal areas of Australia and nearby islands
animals.data: Marsupials with a distinctive long snout
animals.info: Primarily insectivorous and small in size
animals.fact: Have a pouch for carrying their young
animals.description: Small marsupials known for their unique appearance and pouches.

animals.name: Barnacle
animals.habitat: Found attached to hard surfaces in aquatic environments
animals.data: Sessile crustaceans with a shell-like structure
animals.info: Filter feeders that capture food particles from water
animals.fact: Have one of the longest penises relative to body size in the animal kingdom
animals.description: Small, stationary crustaceans that live in marine environments.

animals.name: Barracuda
animals.habitat: Found in tropical and subtropical oceans worldwide
animals.data: Fast-swimming predators with sharp teeth
animals.info: Ambush hunters that prey on smaller fish
animals.fact: Known for their impressive swimming speed
animals.description: Sleek and fearsome-looking fish that inhabit warm ocean waters.

animals.name: Basilisk
animals.habitat: Found in tropical rainforests of Central and South America
animals.data: Also known as the Jesus Christ Lizard due to its ability to run on water
animals.info: Insectivorous and highly agile reptiles
animals.fact: Can reach speeds of up to 5 miles per hour on water
animals.description: Small, arboreal lizards known for their unique running-on-water ability.

animals.name: Bass
animals.habitat: Found in freshwater bodies like lakes, rivers, and ponds
animals.data: Popular game fish with various species
animals.info: Carnivorous and known for their strong fighting ability
animals.fact: Fishing is a popular recreational activity
animals.description: Highly sought-after freshwater fish known for their sportfishing appeal.

animals.name: Bat
animals.habitat: Found in various habitats, including caves, forests, and urban areas
animals.data: The only mammals capable of sustained flight
animals.info: Primarily insectivorous, but some species feed on fruit or nectar
animals.fact: Play crucial roles in pollination and insect control
animals.description: Diverse flying mammals with adaptations for nocturnal life and echolocation.

animals.name: Bear
animals.habitat: Found in a wide range of habitats, from forests to tundra
animals.data: Large, omnivorous mammals with hibernation capabilities
animals.info: Various species, including polar, grizzly, and black
animals.fact: Symbolically significant in many cultures
animals.description: Iconic mammals known for their strength, adaptability, and hibernation habits.

animals.name: Beaver
animals.habitat: Found in freshwater environments with access to wood for dam building
animals.data: Rodents known for building dams and lodges
animals.info: Herbivorous and capable swimmers
animals.fact: Ecosystem engineers, shaping their habitats
animals.description: Industrious rodents known for their dam-building and water-management skills.

animals.name: Bedbug
animals.habitat: Found in human dwellings, especially beds and furniture
animals.data: Blood-feeding insects that cause skin irritation in humans
animals.info: Nocturnal and highly resistant to pesticides
animals.fact: Can survive for months without feeding
animals.description: Parasitic insects that infest human living spaces and feed on blood.

animals.name: Bee
animals.habitat: Found in various ecosystems, including gardens and meadows
animals.data: Important pollinators crucial for plant reproduction
animals.info: Social insects with a caste system (queen, workers, drones)
animals.fact: Produce honey and beeswax
animals.description: Essential insects known for their role in pollination and honey production.

animals.name: Beetle
animals.habitat: Found in diverse terrestrial environments worldwide
animals.data: The largest order of insects with over 350,000 species
animals.info: Hard exoskeleton and chewing mouthparts
animals.fact: Exhibit incredible diversity in size, shape, and behavior
animals.description: Diverse group of insects known for their varied forms and ecological roles.

animals.name: Bird
animals.habitat: Found in virtually all terrestrial and aquatic environments
animals.data: Warm-blooded vertebrates with feathers and beaks
animals.info: Diverse species with various adaptations for flight and terrestrial life
animals.fact: Descendants of theropod dinosaurs
animals.description: Highly diverse vertebrates known for their ability to fly and inhabit diverse habitats.

animals.name: Bison
animals.habitat: Found in grasslands and open plains of North America
animals.data: Large, herbivorous mammals with shaggy fur and humps
animals.info: Social animals that once roamed in massive herds
animals.fact: Nearly driven to extinction in the 19th century
animals.description: Iconic American mammals known for their historical significance and size.

animals.name: Blackbird
animals.habitat: Found in a variety of habitats, including woodlands and urban areas
animals.data: Omnivorous songbirds known for their melodious calls
animals.info: Common are known for their distinctive black plumage
animals.fact: Celebrated in literature and folklore
animals.description: Passerine birds admired for their songs and adaptability.

animals.name: Boa
animals.habitat: Found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas
animals.data: Non-venomous constrictor snakes with muscular bodies
animals.info: Ambush predators that primarily feed on rodents and birds
animals.fact: Some species give birth to live young
animals.description: Constrictor snakes known for their strength and diverse species.

animals.name: Boar
animals.habitat: Found in various habitats, including forests and grasslands
animals.data: Wild swine with distinctive tusks
animals.info: Omnivorous and often forage for food in the ground
animals.fact: Known for their aggressive behavior when threatened
animals.description: Wild pigs known for their adaptability and tusks.

animals.name: Bobcat
animals.habitat: Found in a range of North American habitats, including forests and deserts
animals.data: Medium-sized, solitary cats with distinctive spots and tufted ears
animals.info: Skilled hunters and are known for their elusive nature
animals.fact: Have a wide range of vocalizations
animals.description: Native North American wildcats known for their adaptability and stealthy hunting.

animals.name: Bobolink
animals.habitat: Found in grasslands and meadows of North America
animals.data: Songbirds with striking black-and-white breeding plumage
animals.info: Migratory birds that travel long distances between breeding and wintering grounds
animals.fact: Known for their bubbly, metallic song
animals.description: Migratory songbirds celebrated for their striking appearance and melodious songs.

animals.name: Bonobo
animals.habitat: Found in tropical rainforests of the Democratic Republic of the Congo
animals.data: Close relatives of chimpanzees and humans
animals.info: Known for their peaceful and matriarchal social structure
animals.fact: Resolve conflicts through sexual behaviors
animals.description: Great apes known for their unique social dynamics and close genetic relationship to humans.

animals.name: Bovid
animals.habitat: Found in diverse habitats worldwide, including grasslands and mountains
animals.data: A family of cloven-hoofed mammals, including cattle, sheep, and goats
animals.info: Herbivorous animals known for their economic importance to humans
animals.fact: Have specialized stomachs for digesting plant material
animals.description: Diverse and economically significant mammals known for their cloven hooves.

animals.name: Buffalo
animals.habitat: Found in grasslands and savannas of Africa and North America
animals.data: Large herbivorous mammals with distinctive horns
animals.info: Social animals that often form large herds
animals.fact: Cape are considered one of Africa's most dangerous animals
animals.description: Robust and social mammals known for their iconic horns and herding behavior.

animals.name: Bug
animals.habitat: Found in various terrestrial and aquatic environments
animals.data: A colloquial term often used to refer to various insects
animals.info: Insects belong to the most diverse group of animals on Earth
animals.fact: Some, like bedbugs and stink, are known pests
animals.description: The term is informally used to describe various insects from different orders.

animals.name: Butterfly
animals.habitat: Found in diverse terrestrial environments with flowering plants
animals.data: Insects known for their vibrant wing patterns and proboscises
animals.info: Undergo complete metamorphosis during their life cycle
animals.fact: Monarch are famous for their long-distance migrations
animals.description: Colorful insects celebrated for their beauty and role in pollination.

animals.name: Buzzard
animals.habitat: Found in a variety of habitats, including woodlands and open country
animals.data: Birds of prey known for their soaring flight and sharp talons
animals.info: Opportunistic hunters, feeding on small mammals and carrion
animals.fact: Common are often associated with folklore and superstitions
animals.description: Raptors known for their ability to glide effortlessly in search of prey.
